Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • State

  • public class State
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a state of the Colored-Tile-Puzzle game.
    Author:
    Ori Ben-Hamo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      State(int rowsNum, int columnsNum, int[][] board, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> blackList, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> redList)
      Constructor for the initial state.
      State(State other)
      Copy constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean blackInPlace()
      Checks whether all black tiles are in the right place, otherwise there is no solution to the game for this state.
      java.util.ArrayList<State> createChildren()
      Generates all valid states that can be generated from this state by the operators.
      State createSon(int direction)
      Generates a new state from this state by activating an operator.
      boolean equals(State s)
      Checks whether the boards of this state and 's' are equal.
      int f()
      Computes the 'f' function of the state which is the sum of the heuristic function and the cost till this state.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getBlack()
      Returns the list of the black tiles.
      int[][] getBoard()
      Returns the board of this state.
      int getCoordinate(int x, int y)
      Returns the number in the board that is in the place of the received coordinates.
      int getCost()
      Returns the cost of the path up to this state.
      int getCount()
      Returns the number of vertices produced up to this state.
      int getIteration()
      Returns the iteration in the algorithm that created this state.
      java.lang.String getMove()
      Returns the step is taken to reach this state.
      int getMoveID()
      the direction of the step that created this state (0-left,1-up,2-right,3-down), useful for A*, IDA* and DFBnB for local priority ordering.
      int getOut()
      Returns if this state is mark as "out" (1-out, 0-not out).
      State getParent()
      Returns the parent of this state (the state in which the operator operated to reach this state).
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getRed()
      Returns the list of the red tiles.
      int getX()
      Returns the x-coordinate (row) of the empty place ('_'/0).
      int getY()
      Returns the y-coordinate (column) of the empty place ('_'/0).
      State goal()
      Creates the goal state according to this state
      int heuristic()
      Computes the heuristic function of this state.
      boolean isGoal(State goal)
      Checks whether this is the goal state.
      boolean IsLegal(int row, int column)
      Checks whether the operator is valid, which means it does not exceed out of board limits and does not move a black tile.
      boolean IsParent(int row, int column)
      Checks whether the operator creates the parent state.
      boolean isRed(int x, int y)
      Checks whether the tile at position x,y is red.
      java.lang.String path()
      Computes the path from the start state to this state.
      void replace(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Replaces the value in the board at position x1,y1 with the value at position x2,y2.
      void setCoordinate(int x, int y, int value)
      Updates the value found in the board in the received coordinates with the given value.
      void setCost(int cost)
      Updates the cost of the path up to this state.
      void setCount(int count)
      Updates the number of vertices produced up to this state.
      void setIteration(int iteration)
      Updates the iteration in the algorithm that created this state.
      void setMove(java.lang.String move)
      Updates the step is taken to reach this state.
      void setMoveID(int moveID)
      Updates the direction of the step that created this state (0-left,1-up,2-right,3-down).
      void setOut(int out)
      Updates whether this state is "out" or not.
      void setParent(State parent)
      Updates the parent of this state (the state in which the operator operated to reach this state).
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representing the board of this state

        Constructor for the initial state.
        Parameters:
        rowsNum - the number of rows in the board.
        columnsNum - the number of columns in the board.
        board - the initial board.
        blackList - list of the black tiles in the board.
        redList - list of the red tiles in the board.

      • IsLegal

        public boolean IsLegal(int row,
                       int column)
        Checks whether the operator is valid, which means it does not exceed out of board limits and does not move a black tile.
        Parameters:
        row - the row is given by the operator.
        column - the column is given by the operator.
        Returns:
        true if the operator is valid, else return false.

        column - the column is given by the operator.
        Returns:

      • createChildren

        public java.util.ArrayList<State> createChildren()
        Generates all valid states that can be generated from this state by the operators.
        Returns:
        A list of all the new states generated from this state.

      • createSon

        public State createSon(int direction)
        Generates a new state from this state by activating an operator.
        Parameters:
        direction - indicates the step that the operator needs to take (the direction to take with respect to the empty place).
        Returns:
        the new state.

      • blackInPlace

        public boolean blackInPlace()
        Checks whether all black tiles are in the right place, otherwise there is no solution to the game for this state.
        Returns:
        true if all black tiles are in the right place, else return false.

      • replace

        public void replace(int x1,
                    int y1,
                    int x2,
                    int y2)
        Replaces the value in the board at position x1,y1 with the value at position x2,y2.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the x-coordinate of the first position (row).
        y1 - the y-coordinate of the first position (column).
        x2 - the x-coordinate of the second position (row).
        y2 - the y-coordinate of the second position (column).

      • isRed

        public boolean isRed(int x,
                     int y)
        Checks whether the tile at position x,y is red.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate (row) of the tile.
        y - the y-coordinate (column) of the tile.
        Returns:
        true if board[x][y] is red, else return false.

      • isGoal

        public boolean isGoal(State goal)
        Checks whether this is the goal state.
        Parameters:
        goal - the goal state.
        Returns:
        true if this is the goal state, else return false.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(State s)
        Checks whether the boards of this state and 's' are equal.
        Parameters:
        s - the state compared to this state.
        Returns:
        true if the boards are equal, else return false.

      • path

        public java.lang.String path()
        Computes the path from the start state to this state.
        Returns:
        the path from the start state to this state.

      • heuristic

        public int heuristic()
        Computes the heuristic function of this state. Note that we ignored the black tiles since it is all in their places, it is checked at the start of the search (using the blackInPlace function). This heuristic is based on the Manhattan distance heuristic with a change that is multiplying the steps by the color of each tile.
        Returns:
        the value of the heuristic function.

      • f

        public int f()
        Computes the 'f' function of the state which is the sum of the heuristic function and the cost till this state.
        Returns:
        the value of the 'f' function.
